description:
The Google Compliance team makes sure that our business is always consistent with the current financial regulations. Comprised of master jugglers, this team balances Google's legal and compliance requirements with the dynamic needs of our users and the values of our company. As part of this team, you proactively identify pain points and gaps in existing policy frameworks and find innovative solutions. You develop efficient compliance systems and work with teams to implement these across the organization. You are thorough in all you do and see to it that as Google pursues our next big idea, we always have our bases covered.

As an AML Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for identifying and reporting suspicious activity to the relevant authorities. Core responsibilities include reviewing daily escalations from the transaction monitoring back office, conducting independent investigations, and drafting Suspicious Activity Reports based on reviews related to system generated alerts as well as internal and external referrals. You will also be responsible for providing investigative guidance to an offshore transaction monitoring team.

In this role, you will be involved in compliance cross-functional initiatives to continuously enhance our processes, while balancing the need to support an ever growing business and staying within our regulatory compliance obligations. You will contribute knowledge of BSA and AML/CFT standards as they relate to online Payments and P2P transactions and knowledge of international AML/CFT regulations and standards.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Knowledge of BSA and AML/CFT standards as they relate to online Payments and P2P transactions.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with various international regulatory payments laws, including Money Transmitter/Money Service Business regulations (US), eMoney regulations (UK), Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Sanctions (e.g., OFAC) regulations.
  • Excellent leadership, organization, communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills.
responsibilities:
• Apply investigative techniques to conduct AML reviews and prepare suspicious activity reports when required.
  • Draft comprehensive SAR narratives in line with FINCEN guidelines and maintain investigative procedures Provide feedback to the team responsible for trigger tuning.
  • Provide investigative guidance to back the Office Transaction Monitoring team and periodically develop and deliver investigative related training.
  • Interface with multiple functional areas to enhance our compliance systems and processes, including Compliance Policy, Product, Engineering, and Legal.
  • Meet with internal audit and regulators as needed to effectively communicate the role and responsibilities of AML Operations.
title: AML Operations Analyst
